### Consent form {#consent}

**Use and storage of data.**

- Your data will be collected for a research project at the Toulouse School of 
Economics (TSE-Recherche) led by Dr. Marijn Keijzer.
- The data are collected as part of a public service remit. The data will be 
used for research purposes only.
- We will collect information on your age, gender, charity preferences, and 
attitudes related to the 2016 United Kingdom European Union membership (Brexit) 
referendum.
- The data from the survey will only be saved if you click the submit button at 
the end.
- Only the researchers in charge of the project will have access to your 
personal data.
- Your data will be stored for 3 months after being collected and then 
anonymized.
- The data will not be transferred outside of the EU.
- The anonymized data will be stored on an open science database without any 
personal identification (Prolific IDs will not be included) and will be 
accessible to the rest of the scientific 
community (under CC0 license).

**Personal rights.**

Within the 3 months after you submitted the questionnaire, you have the 
following rights:

- The right to object to the processing of your data and withdraw your consent 
(depending on the case),
- The right to access and rectify your data,
- The right to erase your data,
- The right to a restricted use when your data is not necessary or no longer 
useful.

**Contact.**

You may contact the researchers in charge of the project through Prolific, 
should you have any questions.

The CNRS Data Protection Officer that approved this study can be contacted for 
any questions about the protection of personal data.

- By post: CNRS Data Protection Department, 2 rue Jean Zay, 54519 
Vandoeuvre-l√®s-Nancy, France.
- By email: dpd.demandes@cnrs.fr.

After contacting us, if you feel that your rights regarding data processing, 
data storage and individual freedom have not been respected, you can lodge a 
complaint with the CNIL by post or email.
